name: RhyfoxJS
body:
![Alt RhyfoxJS](http://i297.photobucket.com/albums/mm213/jonathan52380/rhyfoxjs_icon_trasn.png)(logo by [Martin Berube](http://www.iconarchive.com/show/animal-icons-by-martin-berube/fox-icon.html) ) ### What is RhyfoxJS? >RhyfoxJS is a open source platform that allow integrate multiple plugins written in JavaScript for analyze web aplications and runs without need the Web Browser. RhyfoxJS is a utility based in [PhantomJS](http://phantomjs.org/ "PhantomJS") and [CasperJS](http://casperjs.org/ "CasperJS"). With RhyfoxJs you could common tasks such as: > > * Search Broken Links. > * Evaluate Time Load Resources. > * Search Https Security Errors. > * Analyze redirects resources . > * Search Broken Resources. > * Note: RhyfoxJS latest released Version is 1.0.0. ### Get Started This example explain how you can create your plugins and include in RhyfoxJS. Get support. Checkout the [code at Github](https://github.com/jonathan904/RhyfoxJS). Follow [@RhyFoxJS](https://twitter.com/Jonathan904) on Twitter. 1.

Create Plugin Folder

Create a folder into plugins folder of RhyfoxJS project. ```bash $ cd ~/RhyfoxJS/plugins/ $ mkdir /MyPlugin $ cd /MyPlugin ``` 2.

Create Plugin File

The plugin file name must match the plugin folder name. If your plugin require a config file must match the folder name and add the prefix 'config_' in the beginning of the config file name. This config file must contain a JavaScript Object (JSON), this is an optional file. MyPlugin.js ```javascript MyPlugin = function(ObjConfigPlugin) { // config JSON this.url = ObjConfigPlugin.url; this.run = function() { console.log('Hello World!!'); this.api.finish(); //finish plugin } } ``` config_MyPlugin.json ```javascript var config_MyPlugin = { // optional file name: 'NoFound404Plugin', urls: ['URL_Webpage','URL_Webpage2'] } ``` 3.

Run Plugin

RhyFoxJS executes the plugins of automatically for analyze any web aplication. For run the plugin run it: ```bash $ cd ../../src/ $ phantomjs bootstrap.js ``` ### Installation Once PhantomJS's installed on your machine, you should obtain something like this: ```bash $ phantomjs --version 1.5.0 ``` Now just follow these instructions: ```bash $ git clone git@github.com:jonathan904/RhyfoxJS.git $ cd RhyfoxJS ``` You are now ready to create plugins and integrates with RhyfoxJS! ### Authors and Contributors RhyfoxJS is created by Jonathan Alberto Serrano Serrano ([@jonathan904](https://twitter.com/Jonathan904)) with the direction of Iv√°n Rey. RhyfoxJS is a project of graduation of the systems engineering program.
